# ğŸ–Šï¸ `.github/actions/attest/` â€” Artifact Attestations for KFM (Checksums + SBOM + DSSE)

[![CI](https://github.com/bartytime4life/Kansas-Frontier-Matrix/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/bartytime4life/Kansas-Frontier-Matrix/actions/workflows/ci.yml)
[![CodeQL](https://github.com/bartytime4life/Kansas-Frontier-Matrix/actions/workflows/codeql.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/bartytime4life/Kansas-Frontier-Matrix/actions/workflows/codeql.yml)

![Attestations](https://img.shields.io/badge/attestations-enabled-black)
![SBOM](https://img.shields.io/badge/SBOM-required-purple)
![DSSE](https://img.shields.io/badge/DSSE-optional-informational)
![OIDC](https://img.shields.io/badge/OIDC-id--token%3Awrite-important)
![Fail Closed](https://img.shields.io/badge/gates-fail--closed-critical)
![Least Privilege](https://img.shields.io/badge/security-least--privilege-black)

> **KFM `attest`** is a **repo-local composite action** that packages **verifiable evidence** for promotion-grade artifacts:
> - ğŸ”’ `checksums.sha256` (integrity)
> - ğŸ§¬ SBOM(s) (software composition)
> - ğŸ§¾ `build-info.json` (build context)
> - ğŸ” *(optional)* DSSE-style attestation payload(s) (SLSA-inspired provenance binding)
>
> Itâ€™s designed for **promotion lanes** and the **Executor model**: attach proofs + telemetry, **never merge**, **never push to protected branches**.[^executor]

> [!IMPORTANT]
> **KFM order (donâ€™t break it):** ğŸ§° ETL â†’ ğŸ—‚ï¸ Catalogs (STAC/DCAT/PROV) â†’ ğŸ•¸ï¸ Graph â†’ ğŸ”Œ API â†’ ğŸŒ UI â†’ ğŸ¬ Story Nodes â†’ ğŸ§  Focus Mode.[^md-guide]

---

| ğŸ—“ï¸ Last updated | **2026-01-11** |
| ğŸ§± Canon | Contract-first + evidence-first + fail-closed gates[^md-guide] |
| ğŸ¯ Primary purpose | Provenance + integrity for promotion/rollback |
| ğŸ§¯ Default stance | Fail closed, no secrets in logs, least privilege |

## ğŸ§  What this action is

**`kfm/attest`** creates an **attestation bundle** that answers:

- **What** artifacts were produced? (paths + digests)
- **How** were they produced? (build context, toolchain, run identifiers)
- **What else proves integrity?** (SBOM presence, checksum manifest, optional DSSE payload)

### âœ… What it does
1) ğŸ§¾ **Build context capture** â†’ emits (or copies) `build-info.json`  
2) ğŸ”’ **Checksum manifest** â†’ emits `checksums.sha256` for selected artifacts  
3) ğŸ§¬ **SBOM inclusion** â†’ includes SBOM files *if provided* (prefer those generated by `kfm/sbom`)  
4) ğŸ” **Optional DSSE payload(s)** â†’ produces DSSE-style JSON payload(s) for signing/verification (Sigstore keyless is the preferred direction)[^latest-ideas]

### ğŸš« What it does *not* do (by design)
- âŒ It does **not** replace schema validation (STAC/DCAT/PROV)  
- âŒ It does **not** replace policy gating (OPA/Conftest)  
- âŒ It does **not** merge PRs, push to protected branches, or publish on failure[^executor]  
- âŒ It does **not** make trust decisions â€” it packages the evidence so *other* gates/verifiers can decide

> [!NOTE]
> KFM treats reproducibility + traceability as part of security posture (not just â€œnice to haveâ€).[^tech-doc][^nasa-trace]

---

## ğŸš¦ Where this runs in the pipeline

Attestation belongs **after validation** and **before publish**:

```mermaid
flowchart LR
  A["ğŸ§° Build / ETL outputs<br/>code â€¢ data â€¢ catalogs"] --> B["ğŸ” Validate gates<br/>schema â€¢ policy â€¢ QA â€¢ repro"]
  B -->|pass âœ…| C["ğŸ–Šï¸ Attest<br/>checksums â€¢ SBOM â€¢ build-info â€¢ (DSSE optional)"]
  C --> D["ğŸ“¦ Publish / Promote (atomic)<br/>release â€¢ catalogs â€¢ images"]
  B -->|fail âŒ| X["ğŸ§¯ Stop (fail-closed)<br/>no attest â€¢ no publish"]
```

> [!IMPORTANT]
> â€œAttestâ€ is not a gate â€” it should **reflect** gate outcomes by bundling reports/links, never bypassing them.[^md-guide]

---

## ğŸ§¬ KFM invariants this action must uphold

### âœ… Invariants (non-negotiable)

- **Executor contract: never auto-merge.**  
  The Executor model opens/updates PRs and attaches evidence â€” **it does not merge**.[^executor]

- **Fail-closed by default.**  
  If a required input is missing (SBOM/provenance/checksum target), **fail** unless explicitly configured otherwise.

- **Determinism & idempotency-friendly.**  
  Outputs should be stable for the same inputs (avoid unstable timestamps / random ordering). Prefer:
  - stable `run_uuid`
  - explicit `idempotency_key`
  - optional fixed clock (`KFM_VCLOCK_UTC`) for reproducible timestamps[^latest-ideas][^md-guide]

- **Kill-switch must be honored.**  
  Automated lanes must respect a **single-stop control** (kill-switch) to pause risky automation quickly.[^latest-ideas]

- **Least privilege.**  
  Minimal permissions in workflows; no â€œgod tokensâ€; no secrets in logs.[^tech-doc]

- **Sensitive data guardrails.**  
  If a dataset/artifact is classified beyond public, the workflow must treat it as sensitive evidence:
  - restrict uploads
  - avoid public release assets
  - redact logs/telemetry where appropriate[^data-spaces][^tech-doc]

> [!CAUTION]
> **No publish-on-fail.** If validation gates fail, do not generate â€œsuccess-lookingâ€ attestations and do not promote artifacts.

---

## ğŸ§¾ Attestation vs PROV vs STAC/DCAT

KFM uses multiple trust layers (each does a different job):

- ğŸ—‚ï¸ **STAC + DCAT** â†’ discovery + dataset contract (what it is, where it is, license/providers, distributions)[^md-guide]  
- ğŸ§¾ **W3C PROV** â†’ semantic lineage (inputs â†’ activities â†’ outputs, agents, parameters) required for boundary artifacts[^md-guide]  
- ğŸ–Šï¸ **Attestations (this action)** â†’ cryptographic binding of artifact digests to build context (commit/run/tooling), supporting rollback + audit + tamper resistance[^latest-ideas]

> [!NOTE]
> Think of STAC/DCAT/PROV as **meaning** and **lineage**, and this action as the **integrity wrapper** that makes â€œwhat we shippedâ€ verifiable.

---

## ğŸ“¦ KFM Attestation Bundle v1 (contract)

This section is the **contract** policy gates can rely on (paths + stable names).

### âœ… Default output dir
By default, this action writes into:

- `attestations_dir: .artifacts/attestations`

### ğŸ§± Expected layout

```text
ğŸ“ .artifacts/
â””â”€ ğŸ“ ğŸ” attestations/
   â”œâ”€ ğŸ“„ checksums.sha256                 # ğŸ”’ sha256 for all asserted artifacts
   â”œâ”€ ğŸ“„ build-info.json                  # ğŸ§¾ run + toolchain + context
   â”œâ”€ ğŸ“„ attest-summary.md                # ğŸ“ human summary (also to Step Summary)
   â”œâ”€ ğŸ“„ bundle.manifest.json             # ğŸ“¦ machine index for the bundle
   â”œâ”€ ğŸ“„ materials.sbom.spdx.json         # ğŸ§¬ SPDX (prefer from kfm/sbom)
   â”œâ”€ ğŸ“„ materials.sbom.cdx.json          # ğŸ§¬ CycloneDX (optional)
   â”œâ”€ ğŸ“„ provenance.dsse.json             # ğŸ” optional DSSE payload (sign/verify)
   â”œâ”€ ğŸ“ links/
   â”‚  â”œâ”€ ğŸ“„ prov.path.txt                 # ğŸ§¾ pointer to PROV bundle(s)
   â”‚  â”œâ”€ ğŸ“„ catalogs.paths.txt            # ğŸ—‚ï¸ pointers to STAC/DCAT roots
   â”‚  â””â”€ ğŸ“„ gates.paths.txt               # ğŸ§‘â€âš–ï¸ pointers to gate reports (OPA/QA/schema)
   â””â”€ ğŸ“ telemetry/
      â”œâ”€ ğŸ“„ openlineage.events.jsonl      # ğŸ§µ optional lineage events (if provided)
      â””â”€ ğŸ“„ executor.events.jsonl         # ğŸ¤– optional agent/executor events (if provided)
```

> [!TIP]
> Treat the bundle as **immutable evidence**. If you regenerate it, it should be comparable (same subject + same inputs â†’ same checksums), or youâ€™ve found a determinism break worth investigating.[^nasa-trace][^stats-replication]

### ğŸ§¾ `bundle.manifest.json` (recommended shape)

```json
{
  "kfm_bundle_version": "1",
  "subject": "git+https://github.com/<org>/<repo>@<sha>",
  "run": {
    "run_id": "<GITHUB_RUN_ID>",
    "attempt": "<GITHUB_RUN_ATTEMPT>",
    "run_uuid": "<stable UUID>",
    "idempotency_key": "<stable key>"
  },
  "paths": {
    "checksums": "checksums.sha256",
    "build_info": "build-info.json",
    "sbom_spdx": "materials.sbom.spdx.json",
    "sbom_cdx": "materials.sbom.cdx.json",
    "dsse": "provenance.dsse.json"
  }
}
```

---

## ğŸ›ï¸ Inputs

> GitHub Actions inputs are strings. Use `"true"` / `"false"` for booleans.

| Input | Required | Default | Meaning |
|---|---:|---|---|
| `subject` | âœ… | *(none)* | What you are attesting (git subject URI, image digest, release asset path). |
| `artifacts` | âœ… | *(none)* | Newline-separated paths/globs to checksum + include in the bundle. |
| `attestations_dir` | âŒ | `.artifacts/attestations` | Output directory for bundle files. |
| `sbom_spdx_path` | âŒ | *(empty)* | SPDX JSON SBOM path (prefer output of `kfm/sbom`). |
| `sbom_cdx_path` | âŒ | *(empty)* | CycloneDX JSON SBOM path (optional). |
| `build_info_path` | âŒ | *(empty)* | If provided, copy into bundle; otherwise generate `build-info.json`. |
| `prov_bundle_path` | âŒ | *(empty)* | Optional pointer to PROV bundle(s) (e.g., `data/prov/**`). |
| `catalog_paths` | âŒ | *(empty)* | Optional newline-separated STAC/DCAT roots included into `links/`. |
| `gate_report_paths` | âŒ | *(empty)* | Optional newline-separated report paths (OPA/Conftest, schema, QA). |
| `openlineage_event_paths` | âŒ | *(empty)* | Optional lineage events to copy into `telemetry/`. |
| `mode` | âŒ | `bundle` | `bundle` (write + upload) or `sign` (also generate DSSE payload). |
| `signer` | âŒ | `none` | `none` \| `cosign` *(workflow must provide tool)* |
| `fail_on_missing` | âŒ | `"true"` | Fail if any referenced file is missing. |
| `kill_switch_path` | âŒ | `ops/feature_flags/agents.yml` | Kill-switch path for automated lanes.[^latest-ideas] |
| `classification` | âŒ | `public` | `public` \| `internal` \| `confidential` \| `restricted` (drives upload behavior).[^data-spaces] |
| `upload_artifact` | âŒ | `"true"` | Upload bundle via `actions/upload-artifact`. |
| `artifact_name` | âŒ | `attest-${{ github.sha }}` | Artifact name for the uploaded bundle. |

> [!TIP]
> **Subject naming:** dataset and artifact identifiers should be stable and versioned.  
> KFMâ€™s dataset ID conventions can follow patterns like `kfm.<region>.<theme>.<year_range>.v<version>` to ensure uniqueness and traceability.[^tech-doc]

---

## ğŸ“¤ Outputs

| Output | Meaning |
|---|---|
| `bundle_dir` | Directory containing the attestation bundle. |
| `checksums_path` | Path to `checksums.sha256`. |
| `build_info_path` | Path to `build-info.json` (generated or copied). |
| `manifest_path` | Path to `bundle.manifest.json`. |
| `summary_path` | Path to `attest-summary.md`. |
| `dsse_path` | Path to `provenance.dsse.json` *(if produced)*. |
| `bundle_sha256` | Digest of the whole bundle (simple integrity check). |

---

## ğŸ” Required permissions

Minimum recommended permissions per job:

```yaml
permissions:
  contents: read
```

If using keyless signing / Sigstore style attestation, add:

```yaml
permissions:
  contents: read
  id-token: write
```

> [!CAUTION]
> Do **not** run attestation/sign/publish on untrusted fork PRs.  
> Keep attestation on `push main`, tags, or `workflow_dispatch` + protected environments.

### ğŸ›¡ï¸ Environment protection (recommended)
Promotion lanes should use GitHub **Environments** with required reviewers and scoped secrets (no plaintext secrets in workflow files).[^gitops-env]

---

## ğŸ§ª Usage examples

### Example 1 â€” Promotion lane: bundle checksums + SBOM + build-info

```yaml
jobs:
  attest-promotion:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      # Assume validation gates already ran: schema/policy/qa/repro

      - name: ğŸ–Šï¸ Attest (bundle)
        uses: ./.github/actions/attest
        with:
          subject: git+https://github.com/${{ github.repository }}@${{ github.sha }}
          artifacts: |
            data/stac/**/collection.json
            data/dcat/**
            data/prov/**
            reports/gates/**/*
          sbom_spdx_path: .artifacts/attestations/materials.sbom.spdx.json
          build_info_path: .artifacts/build-info/build-info.json
          gate_report_paths: |
            .artifacts/reports/policy-report.json
            .artifacts/reports/schema-report.json
            .artifacts/reports/catalog-qa.json
          upload_artifact: "true"
```

### Example 2 â€” Executor lane: attach evidence to PR (no merge)

```yaml
jobs:
  executor-attest:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      pull-requests: write
      id-token: write  # for keyless proofs (not for merges)

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: ğŸ” Validate (schema/policy/qa/repro)
        run: make agents-validate

      - name: ğŸ–Šï¸ Bundle proofs (never merge)
        uses: ./.github/actions/attest
        with:
          subject: git+https://github.com/${{ github.repository }}@${{ github.sha }}
          artifacts: |
            .artifacts/**/*
            telemetry/**/*
          mode: bundle
          upload_artifact: "true"

      - name: ğŸ§· Open/Update PR (no merge)
        run: python tools/agents/open_pr.py --plan ${{ inputs.plan_path }} --no-merge
```

### Example 3 â€” Sign mode (DSSE payload generated; signing handled by workflow)

```yaml
jobs:
  attest-sign:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      id-token: write

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: ğŸ–Šï¸ Build bundle + DSSE payload
        uses: ./.github/actions/attest
        with:
          subject: git+https://github.com/${{ github.repository }}@${{ github.sha }}
          artifacts: |
            dist/**/*
          mode: sign
          signer: cosign
```

> [!NOTE]
> This action can **generate the payload** and package evidence; the workflow owns:
> - installing/verifying signer tools
> - choosing where to publish attestations
> - enforcing environments + approvals

---

## âœ… Verification expectations

### Checksums (local)
```bash
cd .artifacts/attestations
sha256sum -c checksums.sha256
```

### Bundle sanity
- `bundle.manifest.json` exists and points to real files
- SBOM exists for promotion lanes
- `build-info.json` contains commit SHA, run ID, toolchain versions

### Determinism checks
If the same artifacts are rebuilt from the same inputs, checksum drift should be explainable (or treated as a determinism failure). NASA-grade modeling discipline explicitly expects traceability to specific code versions and controlled configuration management.[^nasa-trace]

---

## ğŸ§¯ Failure modes & troubleshooting

### â€œRequired file missingâ€
- Ensure upstream steps produced the expected artifacts (SBOM/build-info/PROV).
- If using globs, confirm the glob expanded to at least one file.
- For promotion lanes, do **not** disable `fail_on_missing`.

### â€œAttestation bundle differs across runsâ€
Treat as a **signal**, not noise:
- timestamps, file ordering, non-pinned deps, or non-deterministic builds are common culprits
- prefer a fixed clock (`KFM_VCLOCK_UTC`) and stable run identifiers[^latest-ideas]

### â€œSensitive artifacts got uploadedâ€
- Ensure `classification` is set correctly.
- Use GitHub Environments + scoped permissions.
- Avoid uploading sensitive telemetry or raw inputs by default (link to secure storage instead).[^data-spaces][^tech-doc]

### â€œSecrets appeared in logsâ€
- Stop immediately; rotate/replace secrets.
- Add/strengthen scanning in `governance-scan`.
- Remember: many third-party examples hardcode passwords â€” treat them as *anti-patterns*.[^geo-secret]

---

## ğŸ§° Maintainer implementation checklist

When implementing `action.yml` for this README, ensure:

- [ ] Expands newline-separated `artifacts` globs safely and deterministically
- [ ] Emits `checksums.sha256` and `bundle.manifest.json` with stable ordering
- [ ] Generates `build-info.json` if not supplied (include tool versions, runner info)
- [ ] Copies SBOM paths into stable filenames when provided (`materials.sbom.*.json`)
- [ ] Writes a concise `attest-summary.md` + appends to `$GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY`
- [ ] Honors kill-switch in automated lanes (fail closed for publish lanes)[^latest-ideas]
- [ ] Never prints secrets / never exposes secrets via action outputs
- [ ] Respects classification (donâ€™t upload restricted bundles to public locations)
- [ ] Has a smoke workflow using tiny fixture artifacts (always uploads on failure)
